definitions.definition: The quality of a sound independent of its pitch and volume .
The pitch of a sound as heard by the ear, described relative to its absolute pitch.
examples: When someone speaks after inhaling helium, his voice has a higher timbre . With sulfur hexafluoride, the result is a lower timbre .

definitions.definition: The crest on a (helmet atop a) coat of arms .

main_definition: The quality of a sound independent of its pitch and volume .
secondary_definitions: The pitch of a sound as heard by the ear, described relative to its absolute pitch.
( heraldry , uncommon ) The crest on a (helmet atop a) coat of arms .
